abstract: Studies of the formal opinions of Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas, using linguistic software, suggest his majority opinions commonly lift specific language from legal briefs submitted to the court; study results do not imply misconduct, but do illuminate that Thomas is often assigned technical majority opinions involving routine cases, where use of shared language from briefs is common.
lead_paragraph: Researchers found that Justice Clarence Thomas's majority opinions contain language from briefs submitted to the court at unusually high rates.

headline.main: Clarence Thomas, a Supreme Court Justice of Few Words, Some Not His Own
headline.print_headline: A Justice of Few Words, a Number of Them Others’
